largest_contentful_paint.title: Largest Contentful Paint (LCP)
largest_contentful_paint.description: LCP reports the render time of the largest content element that is visible within the viewport.

cumulative_layout_shift.title: Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS)
cumulative_layout_shift.description: CLS measures the sum total of all individual layout shift scores for every unexpected layout shift that occurs during the entire lifespan of the page.

interaction_to_next_paint.title: Interaction To Next Paint (INP)
interaction_to_next_paint.description: INP assesses responsiveness using data from the Event Timing API. When an interaction causes a page to become unresponsive, that is a poor user experience.

experimental_time_to_first_byte.title: Time To First Byte (TTFB)
experimental_time_to_first_byte.description: TTFB is a foundational metric for measuring connection setup time and web server responsiveness in both the lab and the field. It helps identify when a web server is too slow to respond to requests.

first_contentful_paint.title: First Contentful Paint
first_contentful_paint.description: FCP is an important, user-centric metric for measuring perceived load speed because it marks the first point in the page load timeline where the user can see anything on the screenâ€”a fast FCP helps reassure the user that something is happening.

first_input_delay.title: First Input Delay (FID)
first_input_delay.description: FID measures the time from when a user first interacts with a page (i.e. when they click a link, tap on a button, or use a custom, JavaScript-powered control) to the time when the browser is actually able to respond to that interaction.
